meanings.definition: To exceed the limits or boundaries of something.
meanings.sent1: The kids were excessing their energy by running around the playground.
meanings.sent2: She was excessing her speed limit on the highway.
meanings.sent3: The puppy was excessing his cuteness, making everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter excessed the room, filling it with joy.
meanings.sent5: The balloon was excessing with air, ready to pop at any moment.

meanings.definition: The act of removing or eliminating something in excess.
meanings.sent1: The excessing of old furniture made the room feel more spacious.
meanings.sent2: The excessing of unnecessary paperwork saved time and resources.
meanings.sent3: The excessing of sweets from the pantry left only healthy snacks.
meanings.sent4: Her excessing of worries lifted a weight off her shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The excessing of clutter from the garage revealed forgotten treasures.
